issues.description: The template repository and the solution repository use different getter names for the StockIngredient.name field. The template defines/getter usage as getIngredientName() (StockIngredient.java and Stock.findStockIngredient()), while the solution uses getName() (StockIngredient.java and Stock.findStockIngredient()). The problem statement asks students to “add getters for all the private fields” but does not specify the exact getter names; this mismatch between template and solution can confuse students when they compare their work to the reference solution or when instructors provide feedback based on the solution code.
issues.suggested_fix: Standardize the getter name across template and solution. Choose a single getter name for the StockIngredient.name field (for example, getName()) and update both the template and the solution (and any references such as Stock.findStockIngredient) to use that name. Alternatively, document in the problem statement the expected getter names so students know which name to implement.

issues.description: The StockIngredient 'name' getter is named differently in the template and the solution repositories. The template defines/getters as getIngredientName() (and Stock.findStockIngredient() calls getIngredientName()), while the solution uses getName() (and Stock.findStockIngredient() calls getName()). The problem statement asks to "add getters for all the private fields" but does not prescribe a specific getter name, so students reading the template and then consulting the solution (or vice versa) may be confused about which getter name to use. This creates an unnecessary mapping burden: the same conceptual entity (the ingredient's name getter) has two different identifiers across artifacts.
issues.suggested_fix:
Use a single, consistent getter name for the ingredient name across template and solution. For example, standardize on getName():
- In template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/StockIngredient.java, rename getIngredientName() to getName() and update its body accordingly.
- In template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Stock.java, update references from getIngredientName() to getName().
Alternatively, change the solution to use getIngredientName() everywhere. Prefer the simpler conventional name getName() to reduce cognitive load.
